did.unittitle: Brooklyn Democratic Club Silas Wright centennial dinner records
did.abstract: The Brooklyn Democratic Club Silas Wright centennial dinner records include an announcement, programs, clippings, letters, and a ribbon regarding the club's dinner celebrating the 100th anniversary of the birth of Silas Wright in 1895.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The records were formally accessioned in 1978.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn Democratic Club was located at 201 Montague Street. Officers of the Club were Harrington Putnam, President; Alexander Orr and others, Vice-Presidents; Sidney V. Lowell, Chairman of the Governing Committee; Frances Gottsberger, Treasurer; and Charles A. Kelly, Corresponding Secretary.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Silas Wright was born on May 24, 1795. He graduated from Middlebury College in Vermont in 1816. In 1824, he was elected as a New York State Senator. In 1826, he was elected to the U.S. House. From 1829-1833, he served as New York State Comptroller. From 1833-1844, he served as a United States Senator. In 1845, he took office as Governor of New York, but lost his reelection bid in 1846. He passed away on August 26, 1847.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Democratic Club Silas Wright centennial dinner records, 1978.145, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024. At that time, the newspaper clippings were photocopied and the originals discarded.
